intro: Senecio filifolius var. jamesii, commonly known as the James's filifolius groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are typically linear to lance-shaped, with a grayish-green color and a woolly texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky habitats such as cliffs and canyon walls. This plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many common flowering plants.
